title: Typophile Welcomes Ngoc Ngo
content:
We’re pleased to announce Typophile’s first dedicated employee. [Ngoc Ngo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121110039/http:/typophile.com/user/33598/track) is a seasoned consultant and an MFA candidate focused on graphic design at [Academy of Art University](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121110039/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Academy%252Bof%252BArt%252BUniversity). He has joined [Punchcut](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121110039/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Punchcut) at our San Francisco office and will be engaged on a number of initiatives for this site and for the Typophile community.

We’re looking forward to the traction that he’ll bring to our modest world domination plans. Please say hello!
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: Welcome to the first level of your assimilation. ;^)

Lock and load, Ngoc! Welcome to the world of type wackos :-)

ChrisL
How exciting! Congrats, Ngoc! We’re dying to overwhelm you with requests. :D
Birds of the same features flock together.

Thanks everyone! I’m really happy to be here. I’m sure I’ll get to know you all soon enough. For now, be sure to check out my [Typophile blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121110039/http:/typophile.com/blog/33598) to find out more about me and what my typographic interests are.

Ngoc
Very cool, any hints as to what initiatives might be soon started? And if you need any volunteers to help out.
@j\_polo9: I can’t elaborate on any initiatives at this time, but I will say that there’s a good buzz around the office about what’s to come. Stay tuned!
